programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called to the scene of a drive-by shooting, but the case proves less clear-cut than expected when evidence emerges that someone returned fire. The vehicle used is soon traced to an abandoned industrial unit, where a decomposing corpse is uncovered - and Nikki resolves to find out the true cause of death. Guest starring Craig Kelly and Freema Agyeman.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Piece of the Pie
programme.desc: Neil Manson returns to Sun Hill to work on the murder of a gay man and Phil Hunter spots a pattern in similar recent crimes. Lance Powell teams up with Laura Bryant to investigate a spate of robberies for which the local vicar turns out to be the chief suspect. Mark leaves his partner distraught when he moves out to find some space, and Cindy urges her reluctant husband to open the results of the paternity test.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy is charged with murder, and an accident in a college science laboratory leads to a horrific fire. Meanwhile, Carole gets her revenge on Davies.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Ross Kemp Living With
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part special to begin the second series, the actor and film-maker examines the real-life impact of dementia. He meets Scott Mitchell, the husband of his former on-screen mum Barbara Windsor, who was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2014. Ross also travels to Leatherhead, Surrey, where he stays with Jerry Beckman, an actor, magician and keen sportsman who has early-onset dementia and Parkinson's disease.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Phil Vickery, husband of host Fern Britton, acts as judge as nine home cooks are whittled down in three intense culinary battles. Phil starts by demonstrating how to finely puree garlic before contestants must attempt their own in just five minutes. Then six players are tasked to prepare a loin of venison from a rack, before the last three are given just two minutes to select from the larder containing an array of fresh fruit and vegetables, pulses and grains, condiments and sauce ingredients to pare with their prepared venison. A prize of £1,000 awaits the successful candidate.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: The Magic Singles of the Week
programme.desc: These are the top 20 songs we're loving right now. Stay tuned for a delicious mix of today's feel-good favourites and a huge dollop of laidback loveliness straight from the Magic HQ.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how seaweed is turned into sushi wrapping, how beer bottles that last for 15 years are made, and how surfers try to keep themselves safe from sharks.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Volvo P1800 - but owing to a lack of available specimens, has trouble finding one that fits into his price range.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys uncover toy cars worth as much as the real thing, and a stash of custom motorbikes with an incredible backstory.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team plans to build a bike on stage in front of numerous fans. However, when rehearsals hit an unexpected hitch, panic ensues.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: The approaching winter means an annual exodus, and Luke attempts to complete a rescue before the sun sets on Unalakleet for two months.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unpleasant tasks, each involving a certain amount of grime and discomfort.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in making firefighter helmets, nautical compasses, packaging tubes and hand saws.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Halogen Bulbs/Aluminium Ladders/Cellulose Insulation/Bamboo Fly Rods
programme.desc: The techniques used in the making of halogen bulbs, aluminium ladders, cellulose insulation and bamboo fly rods.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A seemingly charming and generous man who targets vulnerable women for his vicious attacks is tracked in a country-wide manhunt.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases unravelled by forensic examiners, including the discovery of a woman's decapitated body by a fisherman and a reported suicide involving a toxic liquid.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: Pensacola Police investigate the disappearance of popular news reporter Sean Dugas, and find themselves drawn into an addictive world of gaming. Meanwhile, across state a mother vanishes after a family party and a neighbour's CCTV reveals a shocking tale of murder and betrayal.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The 1992 deaths of Tommy Griffin and his sister Connie Griffin Branham, both killed by shotgun wounds to the head. Gary Wayne Sutton and James Henderson - associates of Tommy Griffin - were convicted of the murders. Connie was killed a few days after her sibling while enquiring his whereabouts.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: An investigation into a US bank robbery in 1997, during which two armed men opened fire on staff and police officers at close range.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Stolen cattle are found abandoned beside a road, and officials investigate a case involving a Chihuahua that has been put into storage.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown feels the pressure when he comes to the aid of a distressed Sumatran tiger with a tooth problem.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights her mother for control of the dress choice while a military bride argues over how her maids should look.
